gw.api.iterator

Interface IteratorBackingData<T,F extends IFilter>


  • public interface IteratorBackingData<T,F extends IFilter>
    Represents a data fed to RowIterator as a value. May be a wrapper for remote data source.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void applyFilters(java.util.List<F> filters)
      Applies filters to all subsequent requests to the remote data source.
      IteratorSumResult calcSum(java.lang.String expression)
      If the implementation does not support in memory summing then this method would be invoked to get sum of all entries.
      java.util.List<T> getEntries(int startIndex, int numEntries, java.util.List<IteratorBackingDataSorting> sortings)
      Returns numEntries entries starting at startIndex and sorted with sortings
      default java.util.stream.Stream<T> getEntryStream()
      Returns a stream of entries if this implementation support in-memory summing.
      java.lang.Class<F> getFilterType()
      The type of Filter this BackingData expects.
      int getNumEntries()
      Returns the total number of all entries
      void resetFilters()
      Drops any filters applied to the data source backed by this object.
      default boolean supportsInMemorySumming()
      If backing data is local then the interface can provide in-memory summing function.

    • Method Detail

      • getFilterType

        java.lang.Class<F> getFilterType()
        The type of Filter this BackingData expects. Any other types of Filters will cause a runtime error.
        Returns:
        the class that all Filters must extend.

      • applyFilters

        void applyFilters(java.util.List<F> filters)
        Applies filters to all subsequent requests to the remote data source.

      • resetFilters

        void resetFilters()
        Drops any filters applied to the data source backed by this object.

      • getEntries

        java.util.List<T> getEntries(int startIndex,
                             int numEntries,
                             java.util.List<IteratorBackingDataSorting> sortings)
        Returns numEntries entries starting at startIndex and sorted with sortings
        Parameters:
        startIndex - is an index of the first entry on the page.
        numEntries - represents a number of entries on a page. Does not matter if the last page has just, for instance, 2 entries, numEntries may still be a default page size - an implementation should take this into account and don't throw an exception.
        Returns:
        a list of entries to display

      • getNumEntries

        int getNumEntries()
        Returns the total number of all entries

      • supportsInMemorySumming

        default boolean supportsInMemorySumming()
        If backing data is local then the interface can provide in-memory summing function. In this case, the method should return true and getEntryStream() should give an access to all entries via Stream API.

      • getEntryStream

        default java.util.stream.Stream<T> getEntryStream()
        Returns a stream of entries if this implementation support in-memory summing.

      • calcSum

        IteratorSumResult calcSum(java.lang.String expression)
        If the implementation does not support in memory summing then this method would be invoked to get sum of all entries.
